intro: Jacobaea vestita, commonly known as the woolly groundsel, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its hairy, gray-green leaves and yellow composite flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is typically found in rocky or sandy soils. Jacobaea vestita is often used in gardens for its ornamental value and drought tolerance. It plays a role in supporting local pollinators and has some traditional medicinal uses in indigenous communities.
